name: nytimes
text: “J.K. Rowling gave us Harry Potter; she gave us this world. But we created the fandom, and we created the magic and community in that fandom. That is ours to keep.” https://t.co/Ea14zyOVYg

name: nytimes
text: Immigrants in at least a dozen ICE facilities have announced protests and strikes, demanding measures to protect them from Covid-19 and that ICE release the sick, elderly and high-risk among them https://t.co/PQIYtfFqQ1

name: nytimes
text: A court in the Philippines convicted Maria Ressa, a veteran journalist and outspoken critic of President Rodrigo Duterte, of cyber libel, in the latest blow to press freedoms in the country https://t.co/76HfH0JVGo

name: nytimes
text: RT @NYTimesAtWar: "As one of the only Jews in my unit, I had to be careful. Anti-Semitic officers would select me for the most dangerous missions. Knowing how to negotiate, how to talk to people, who to trust, when to follow and break rules saved me." https://t.co/WTcP1oWMzs

name: nytimes
text: Rayshard Brooks was shot and killed by a police officer on Friday in Atlanta. His death intensified a growing re-examination of the enormous leeway officers are given to make split-second life-or-death decisions without hesitation or fear of prosecution. https://t.co/oJ4t8faiYo

name: nytimes
text: RT @S_Evangelina: Two black men were found hanged from trees in California. The deaths occurred 10 days and 50 miles apart. The family of Robert Fuller is demanding an investigation and the family of Malcom Harsch has started conducting their own. My story: https://t.co/i6AxTR0ChX

name: nytimes
text: President Vladimir Putin said the U.S. was gripped by a “deep internal crisis.” The Russian leader described an America poisoned by racism and violence and paralyzed by the refusal of President Trump’s opponents to accept the 2016 election results. https://t.co/LfvwA4QFZK

name: nytimes
text: RT @benyt: I reported from East Hampton this week https://t.co/blLCbxR2Q6

name: nytimes
text:
Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York is not the only official to warn of a reimposed lockdown in the face of surging cases. Around the U.S., officials have watched closely as the coronavirus mounts a resurgence. 

Live updates about the pandemic: https://t.co/01DNEkH4Jc

name: nytimes
text: RT @motokorich: From Australian lobsters to German lighting to Japanese toliets, it turns out it’s not easy to find other markets to take China’s place w/ @damiencave @JackEwingNYT https://t.co/SaxGoJaFRm

name: nytimes
text: Two major study retractions in one month have alarmed scientists worldwide who fear that the rush for research on the coronavirus has overwhelmed the peer review process and opened the door to fraud https://t.co/QzxrOhGJ3n
